The ONLY thing that keeps them from running more UR people off, is the company is so law suit scared, you have to have a lot of proof to fire anyone (Even the bad people), so that's a double edged sword. You have NO chance of promotion or going any further unless you move to another store. They save the promotions for the hiney-kissers!!

job_title: Inside Sales Representative in Denver, CO
pros: I enjoyed the people the most. Benefits were great, 401K match was good but you have to work a minimum of two years to get the pay out and they don't share that part with you. They put you through a training program for equipment knowledge and Rental Man training.
cons: Frustrating working in the call center, the programming is difficult to learn at first and you are on the phone under pressure right away with little to no training. I started in the Sales Associate program with commission opportunity, then moved into ISR role losing my commission.  Long hours 7-5 (sometimes 6)

review_title: Growing too fast for its own good
job_title: Outside Sales Representative in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Excellent benefits, company vehicle, safety culture. You get to work and grow an existing book of business.
cons: They measure everything and set unrealistic expectations. Workload is overwhelming and they demand more. No work/life balance if you want to be successful. In the end it's all about the profits and shareholders. Too many acquisitions inheriting reps that are not up to par and they keep cutting territories.  Plug & play mentality, if a rep leaves they just replace him/her and stat the process again. Customers are used to having a new rep every month.

pros: Good beneifits and generaly good people to work with at the branch level. The retirement plan is good as they match up to 3 pecent  of your pay towards it. hours of opperation are also good .
cons: Upper management is inconsistent with what they do or what they want and expect from the employes. There is never enough time to complete one job before something else is thrown at you and then they get upset that you could not finish the first project that was gven to you. There is to much bouncing around and no consistant leadership with in the company.

review_title: I have been employed by UR PHVAC for about 3 years and you would have to drag me away kicking and screaming.
job_title: Senior Industrial Account Manager in La Porte, TX
pros: Benifits are second to none.  Competative compensation.  The company seems to care for their employees and the support at each branch is like none i've seen before.  I have been afforded the opportunity to work my territory and manage it with only positive direction from management.
cons: Any cons i have had have been addressed by management and resolved to the benifit of myself and the Company.  UR has their best interest at heart but they understand that their employees are what makes UR sucessful.

job_title: Senior Customer Care Representative in Charlotte, NC
pros: Great benefits. Pay is okay. PTO, 401K, decent location.
cons: No promotional value; you would have had to have been here when they first opened to get promoted. Micro management; Enough pay to keep you around but not enough to make someone happy; Stagnant in position, no career growth; People start to feel under appreciated because of the amount of work you do but not noticed or rewarded.

pros: Team oriented and goal driven.  If you want to work for a company where your success lies within your own doing and what type of effort you put into it, this is the company for you you.
cons: I have zero complaints about my job or company.  The company is always trying to find ways to improve the customer's experience and build capacity to fill customer needs.

pros: Great company objective overall, pay is decent, good benefits.
cons: Salary employees do the same job as hourly employees plus their respected duties.  People try to rent equipment before it has been properly received for and deemed rental ready.  Everything evolves around numbers and not actual reality.  They keep equipment around forever that should of been sold or trashed 10 years ago.

review_title: Scary how much things have changed in the last 12 months
pros: There is a lot of freedom and they give you the tools and training you need to be successful. Anyone in the sales positions are more than willing to help and support
cons: Micro management is overwhelming. They are so focused on on making the sale force numbers look good that they lose track of what's important. The compensation keeps changing and getting smaller and smaller

pros:
Company Truck
Work independently mostly
Company Phone with Unlimited Hotspot that you can also use personally
Company expense card for any job related expenses I.E Customer lunches, gifts, etc
Ok base salary and Uncapped earning potential
cons:
Depends on your manager
Some want you on your first job site at 6:30AM and can be micromanaged
Have to be on call after hours around every 5 weeks for a whole week and take calls after 5pm
Little to no training - learn by trial by fire

review_title: A first class company that is building the rental business into a true business and desirable career.
pros: The senior leadership continues to push the company in the direction of true progress, innovation and equality in an industry that has not traditionally fostered those values.
cons: The high speed pace of growth and innovation create challenges in terms of a work/life balance.  It comes from a positive place, people are excited about the direction and willing to follow the leadership, but it sometimes gets lost that we should be able to have the energy to enjoy our families and free time as well to make us better employees overall.

pros: Company is very committed to its people, safety career development and compensation are outstanding. If you want to place to work where they believe in you and want you all they can to develop your career this is the place. United Rentals is by far the best company I’ve ever worked for.
cons: Absolutely none. There’s not a better place to work. I’ve been with the company for two years, it’s not often that a fortune 500 company will give you an opportunity.

pros: Coworkers , 401k matching, overtime seasonally available for hourly employees
cons:
Your salary in the OSR position is 25k annually. Your commission is between 1-3% of the rental based on the rate you achieve. However to be competitive in your market it's rarely possible to earn more than 1%. Another disadvantage is the splitting of territories. Territories that used to have one rep now have 3. Senior reps are making less than ever. 
The favoritism aspect others have commented is definitely true. Your DSM and DM that you work for will make or break your career.

job_title: Inside Sales Representative in Geismar, LA
pros: Benefits are great.  Hours of operation are respectable.  Safety education is mandatory and practiced everyday.  UR is an elite club and they don't just hire anyone, so you're surrounded by great employees throughout.  Quality, family, and safety are preached and practiced here and that was one of the deciding factors of joining the team.
cons: Learning curve coming from another industry was a little  intimidating, but everyone was there to help and still is.  Learning everyday.

pros: Innovative, forward thinking company that values their inside clients (employees) and takes great care of them so we are honored, inspired, and driven to provide high quality experience for our clients.
cons: There are none! It's a business & company that deserves your second look - you can start anywhere, grow, and flex, and become whatever you desire - from sales, to service to driver to safety, administrative, and accounting - and that's not all!

review_title: Great  place to build a career with good people!
pros:
Great support from peers and mgmt.
Career development - career maps, internal talent profiles, and development training programs.
Not only do we have external customer service we have great internal customer service with "1UR"  
Employee Resource Groups - Women United, Veteran United, Together United. These are are great relationship building internal and giving back to a variety of communities/groups 
Good benefits with lots of great savings i.e. Wellness Event $600 savings and more.
cons: None at this time. The positives out way any cons. If I have and any cons they were small and no longer a con.

review_title: A fast paced environment committed to excellance in all phases of the business and rewarding both financially and profe
pros: The company is focused on proftable growth, with an expereinced managemnt team in place to drive results, Rewards employee's and stockholders.
cons: Time managemnt can be challenging, as Initiaves are introduced. Process'es in place across business disciplines can be reactive, manuel and time consuming, that at times can take focus off of providing the best prodcuts and services for our customer base.

review_title: Average job, nothing special. Take what you learn and move on to expand your talent!
job_title: IT/Applications Support- Helpdesk in Houston, TX
pros: A good start for someone wanting to break into the construction equipment rental industry.
cons:
Alot of imcompetence at the company due to lack of training from the managers all the way down!

Glass ceiling on advancement
Lack of initiative in employees.

pros: Pays well for the position your in.  Wonderful benefits and matching 401k program. Has buying perks (sometimes it works)
cons: Renting equipment to customers before the equipment is back from previous renter. Leaving very little time for maintenance to inspect and fix defective equipment. This causes bad equipment to go to the customer knowing full well the equipment may be unsafe or will break.  This puts the maintenance back out on the road to face a very angry customer. Also, managers get a bonus and sales reps get commissions but maintenance personel dont. Work orders disappear on equipment that's in maintenance and suddenly being rented. Branch manager and above are always previous sales reps. I have never seen a maintenance supervisor promoted to Branch Manager. working for UR as a mechanics is unsafe legally.  The CMMS is old, out dated, and leaves gaping holes for manipulation other than maintenance oersonnel.  There is NO team environment for UR.  UR can do nothing w/out the maintenance team yet they are treated horribly and are blamed for everything- because once it is out the gate it is a maintenance problem to fix or report.

job_title: Inside Sales Representative in San Antonio, TX
pros:
-Integrity-One of the 1st things that stood out to me about in my 1st interview was the integrity I felt my manager had as a employer. Then when I started I saw that same integrity in my peers. 
-Work ethic- I love how this company respects the work they do and values the roles of others. I love how workplace is used to cultivate company synergy and provide best practices, recognition and I feel it really united people at UR from all over. 
- Genuine care for employees. I feel there is genuine care from the leadership of this company and that they value their employees and want them to grow and develop. I see a lot of compassion and concern to develop people.
cons:
- I get bored easily, so at times when work is slow I don't feel much is provided to keep me occupied. I realized different branches have different level of activity at times but I feel during down times different projects, trainings or developmental work can be provided so we can constantly use our time at work to be productive and stay sharp.
-Technology- I feel as a company we are somewhat outdated in our technology. Computer systems are slow and computer software is older. I feel we can move QUICKER and be top notch if we upgrade our technology!
-Not as appealing to the Millennial generation. I am a Millennial and I notice the culture of the company Is a bit more inviting to the older generation which is GREAT! bc its our foundation, however as a millennial there are certain things in the culture I feel could be altered or adjusted to invite and engage that generation for long term loyalty and contribution.

pros: United Rentals offers an above average compensation package for this area.
cons: United Rentals promotes by who you know, not what you know. In most cases you will find management is promoted beyond his/her capabilities in all areas of the company. The constant change in programs signals weak management and popular opinion attributes the changes to "jobs justification" in a weak economy.

review_title: Good stability, big company "drink the KoolAid" mindset.
pros: The company is extremely stable, and if you tow the company line you'll have a job there forever.
cons: Towing the company line.  I was told to agree with senior management even if my years of business experience told me different action was necessary.  Agility and innovation in management are not this company's strong points.

review_title: There are opportunities within United Rentals, but at what sobering costs -- think long and hard and do your research!
pros: United Rentals has a national footprint and, therefore, provides opportunities for transfering to places in which you may desire to live.  Also, the industry (construction) is pretty straight forward and often rewarding.  It is a company that adheres to its own safety standards.  I am thankful for the opportunity that United Rentals gave me in going to work for them.
cons: True to stories I heard prior to entering employment with United Rentals, senior management had very questionable management tactics.  My district manager at the time of my employment with United Rentals was a very callous bully.  Though I interacted with him very little, relatively speaking, his influence was pervasive and created an incredibly disspiriting atmosphere, not just within my location, but also within the region.  Before one interprets this as a single person issue, the head of marketing for the company displayed much of the same behavioral overtones.  For example, more than once they came to my location and demanded off-the-cuff responses from our manager and sales staff in meetings with the entire branch in attendance (welder, yard men, mechanic, counter staff) to questions of internal financial roll up figures and competitors' daily inventory status that would require, at minimum, research and/or referencing reports.  Mine was one of the better producing locations within the region and yet was still, in effect, gripped by fear.  Additionally, the same could be said for all but one of the other district managers -- though much of my evidence for this is hearsay.  I cannot simply write this off to United Rentals being a good ol' boys club, though there are a lot of those traits.  I simply think that some companies are poorly run while others are well run.  And, heck, maybe I just had a bad experience?!  The biggest and best insight, in retrospect, that I received prior to accepting the offer from United Rentals is that one's success and quality of life with the company is largely dependent upon one's direct manager.  Unfortunately, the managers across the board appear to be negatively motivated and they do not appear to be selected based upon their virtuosity by any means.  While I am thankful for the opportunity that I was given to work for United Rentals, I am also very glad I moved on.  I have never worked for a company that I ended up feeling so empty about in the final analysis in terms of the climate, direction, purpose, etc.

review_title: If you want a challenging career while working with a high powered management team, come to UR.
pros:
You can make an impact.  The company continues to grow and has a solid strategic vision.  When critics thought UR could not withstand the economic downturn of several years ago, the management team had a strategy that lead us through some rough times that lined us up to pull off the most successful and largest merger in the industry. 

Company is very military friendly and recognizes its service veterans.
cons: You need to know how to balance work and family.

review_title: Best company to work for in the industrial field
job_title: Regional Recruiter in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Focus on safety, teamwork and community.  Training is one of the top priorities for both exempt and nonexempt employees.  Opportunity for growth is tremendous.  Highly competitive salaries.
cons: Need more personnel to keep up with the tremendous growth that we are encountering.  More vacation time and holidays off would be encouraged.

job_title: Sales Development Program in Charlotte, NC
pros: Pay is $23.57 an hour which great, especially for what we do-outbound calls.
cons: Managers of the program should focus more on real sales experience. So more ride along a with outside sales reps and job site visits. Never got core four certified for equipment due to cancellations from the trainer. No focus on selling used equipment, focus was only on renting. Stack rank system is flawed and rewarded false reservations to reps who put deals without customer permission.

pros: United Rentals is an amazing company to work for.  Not only is my salary higher than the Industry standard but I have excellent benefits as well!  I also appreciate the team oriented culture my opinion is frequently sought after and considered in the decision making process.
cons: Sometimes important decisions about new initiatives or practices can take too much time to move through the corporate chain of command.

job_title: Branch Manager in San Antonio, TX
pros: Very good leadership in place and the training programs available for all levels of employment is top notch.  Senior leadership truly create a family type of approach with the sales and sale support teams.  Incredible approach toward safety at every level of the organization.
cons: Very minimal but if I had to say, there is always opportunity to improve our overall processes.  certainly based on our current economic conditions.

pros: United has great medical and dental benefits.  You have opportunity to move up as long as you have a degree and know someone.
cons: The benefits are more expensive for hourly employees versus salaried employees.  You have to make a great first impression otherwise you are doomed for your career.  In order to get a decent pay raise, you have to leave and come back.

review_title: Decent place to work, as long as you stay to yourself, and stick up for yourself
pros:
Largest in the industry,
Lots of availability to move while staying at the company.
cons:
Experiences can vary wildly from branch to branch.
Generally understaffed for expected business growth on logistical side.
In my experience mid and upper management will not return phone calls unless emergency.
Definately have to watch your back, they will let people go very quickly.

review_title: United Rentals. Biggest doesn't make it the best  company to work for
pros: Big company. Physical working conditions are good. Pay rate is good. Overtime available if wanted. Something different every day because of variety of equipment. Never boring. Day seems to go quickly.
cons:
Policy and Procedure Bulletins are up to the discretion of management to follow up with how they want to.. Because it is written doesn't mean it needs to be followed by management. Going up the ladder with an issue, all the way to HR and believing they are listening and not getting results is very discouraging. The company pushes safety and work stoppages when an unsafe act is seen but no one listens. It seems that most of it is all talk, and United is doing it for company ratings and not the safety of the employee or customer.. United has gotten so big it seems that they have forgotten about the employee. You're just a number anymore.
 Because of its size United is more concerned with how its numbers look to stock holders. Because of the need to get equipment from the prep line to ready line and delivered to the customer quickly, quality is down. Customers are getting equipment that breaks down immediately and in some cases is unsafe. The customer should be the main concern and they are not anymore.

pros: Freedom.  An outside sales person does not have to be confined in an office.  Additionally, there is a considerable amount of opportunity to take time off to do things in one's personal life.  Also, there is a fairly decent opportunity to make a fair amount of money.
cons: Management is incompetent.  There is very little upward growth opportunity.  The customer retention rate is awful.   Employees are not treated fairly or valued.  I saw many employees fired without warning or reason.  The pay is not sufficent to attract good employees and there is a tremendous amount of employee turnover.  There is no loyalty, at all!

review_title: Be aware of the call centers jobs
job_title: Inside Sales Representative in Charlotte, NC
pros: Overall okey company good time off
cons:
They always recruit for inside sales position out of Charlotte or Tampa. Unbelievable nonsense , Worst  management I have ever seen and I was a manger in my previous job.
If you are the call center other company employees don’t even show you respect. They know the center is a joke and the mangers there never nor have any construction experience yet they are making the processes there.

Processes actually goes against the real on site branches

review_title: "Layed-off" - If You're Not  In, You're Out.
job_title: Just Under Branch Manager in Denver, CO
pros:
Since branch employees rarely saw the District Manager or above, The Branch Manager made the atmosphere of the branch  positive or negative. If lucky enough to get hired into the right branch location, the reasons to enjoy the job could be numerous.   I experienced both. The team environment was attempted fervantly. 
The compensation was perhaps the best reason to work for the company. The benefit structure was impressive and appreciated.The Benefits offered by Blue Cross/Blue Shield were second to none. Until 2009, the company offered fifty cents on the dollar match into the 401K plan up to $12,500 (I cant remember exactly).
cons:
Half of the contry experienced Seasonal Lay-offs. Lay-offs were announced on a moments notice leaving employees with no time to prepare. 
The lack of contact from senior management left the employees thinking that the corporate office was acting under the "ivory tower" attitude. Even with the 'extrinsive motivation' fed by the pay and benefits offered by the company, the feeling of expendiblity and fear loomed in the atmosphere hindering the growth of the more productive 'intrinsic motivation' such as inner satisfaction or the genuine desire to perform the tasks. 'An employee is only as good as last month's numbers.' 
Time is not provided to properly maintain the equipment as should be provided.

review_title: It's a job and it keeps the bills paid
pros: Most of the people you work with are great. At the branch level it is almost like a family and that makes for a great work environment.
cons: The insurance plan is sub par. I don't know if that is the company's fault or the provider. They tell you to go to minor med but when you do, you get a bill because the copayment doesn't cover you being seen.

review_title: Good for a job, not a career
pros: free lunch Fridays, uniform service, flexible hours, pretty good people for the most part, pretty lax atmosphere most of the time. A few solid guys in the shop.
cons: One or two crappy employees with horrible work ethics. Sometimes too much pressure to get equipment out and correct repairs are not made. Under trained, unskilled, under tooled "mechanics". At the end of the day, the only thing that matters are the phony numbers and making the shareholders more cash.

pros:
M-F work, rarely work weekends.
Get to meet diverse customers and help them. Good inside reps and techs
Not too many other Pros
cons:
Cronyism

Nepotism

Good old boy club exist in outside reps, branch managers, DM's and above

Ethics are questionable, and morals are rare at BM levels. There are some good ones, but not many left

Repair techs and inside reps are taken for granted constantly and disrespected 


Most of promotions to management are given to white males in the secret club, it's not about your talent it's only about the "good old boy system" 

UR in great numbers is now Hiring poorly qualified individuals from outside the company into outside sales roles, customers take notice and will complain, business suffers due to it, and inside reps have to work harder to compensate for their incompetency. 

Inside reps have more responsibilities than just about any other position, you take all calls coming in, manage all emails, source everyone's equipment needs, dispatch, type in outside reps work because they get away with not doing so. Negotiate hauling, the endless tasks a BM will add to your never ending TO Do pile or what they just don't want to do. Many more and plus now you have to take many calls from the incompetent outside staff that they hired with no experience in the industry and process their requests because they don't know what their doing.

Benefits are expensive in premiums, less than average deductibles and out of pocket high limit pretty high.

pros:
The company has good/ fair pay to it's employees.
The company has good long hours for those who like to work a lot.
Overall good people in the workplace.
cons: The Company has mandatory overtime that is required daily. Long hours, 12 hour days are not uncommon, five days a week, Saturdays when busy.Tons of Micro Management, and Poor training, learn as you go attitude.

review_title: Good place to work but they are downsizing in every phase of the business.
pros: Good pay.  Interesting Industry.  Good place to work when the economy is moving forward.  In a positive economy this is a great industry with many opportunites.
cons: In the current economic decline UR is making extreme cuts.  Maybe too extreme in some areas.  Almost panic type moves.  Tough times call for tough measures.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Charlotte, NC
pros: The job is clear cut and simple to perform.
cons: Very robotic. You are micromanaged and monitored very heavily when it comes to break times. Your performance is heavily based off of how much time you are "available" to take phone calls, so it's difficult to take any time to grab a coffee or even use the toilet.

review_title: Poor training - No respect from Upper Management
job_title: Inside Sales Representative in Knoxville, TN
pros: Hours are good.  Pay is fair.  No weekends, except 1 every ten weeks or so.  In-store management team positive to work for.  Good benefits
cons:
Unreliable Management
No training - Training On the Job
Lack of Trust from Upper Management
Make promises they do not keep
No truthful to customers- just worried about the bottom dollar

pros: URI is very strong on equipping all employee's with the tools to perform their job to the fullest.  They have very good access to the proper technology and processes to make it a very successful career.
cons: It is a very large Corporation so it can be difficult to understand the direction we are pushing at times.

job_title: Inside Sales Representative in Columbus, OH
pros: Great benefits and they try to put a system in place to make the job easy.
cons: Male dominated, testosterone rich environment.  Inappropriate behavior both from customer base (we look the other way) and the coworkers.

pros: Excellent place to work. Great benefits. Employee morale is high - corporate support consistent. Awesome company to work for.  Management helps create a positive work environment so one might look forward.
cons: There is such a demand for United Remtals equipment due to the quality and dependability that sometimes there just aren't enough backhoes or excavators to go around.

job_title: Inside Sales Representative in Dade City, FL
pros: Cool people to work with. Pretty flexible schedule. Opportunity to advanced if you're able to move or if you know somebody.
cons: Open positions more often than not seem to be promised to someone else and are only posted for legal reasons. Company seems to do a lot of hiring from outside. Typical office politics and playing favorites.

review_title: United could be a great company if they would just decide what they want to be and to whom.
pros: Great people for the most part, capable of helping customers with many resources at hand.  Benefits are better than average.
cons: zero teamwork between branches, vast amounts of time spent ensuring that other branches are not hurting your business.  Company is always trying to shift directions, they need to stick to renting quality equipment.

review_title: Very Demanding of its employees, but can be very rewarding on many levels
pros: Compensation, benifits, diversity of responsability, not boring
cons: Inconsistancy with accountability, functions like a bunch of different companies vs one at times

pros: job security, biggest rental company in united states.  Great stock. Have made some good moves over the last five years and have put themselves in position to succeed.
cons: No matter how hard you work as a territory manager your pay will not go up because they are constantly changing territories and commission structure. Management is bad about putting equipment sales in house accounts so they don't have to pay the reps a commission on it.

review_title: Lucky I found a great company
pros: There are locations all across the country. I know I can work anywhere in the country (if there is a position open) and grow with the company. I have been able to meet a lot of people throughout the company at different training events. There is so much potential to grow with the company, we get uniforms provided, great benefits, and many useful tools.
cons: If you do not speak up and go for the next job what you want, you can easily get lost in a large corporation.

pros: As a territory manager you have a lot of freedom to create your own work week. You have high goals to meet each month but you set the pace. They provide a company vehicle, company credit card and cell phone. Lots of opportunity for vertical growth
cons: Make you sign a non-compete. Micro-management using Salesforce is excessive. Constantly changing focus on what they want you to sell. Too much work - not enough money because they keep shrinking your territory

pros: What an incredible place to work.  Culture is everything and this companies commitment to safety, it's people and our customer is top notch.  Our leadership truly care about all of us and we recognize all our folks for the amount of work we put in.  Great compensation
cons: long work weeks are normal and expected.  Always seem to need more fleet.

review_title: United Rentals provides an extremely positive and encouraging workplace!
job_title: National Account Manager in Remote, OR
pros: United Rentals is highly supportive of an employee and focused on results.  The leadership team is outstanding and continue to communicate the strategy for continued growth. With an incredible footprint in the US & Canada, an individual can work from any location with few limitations.
cons: The only downside, in today's environment, is the international reach.  Today, United Rentals is located only in the US and Canada; having a footprint in emerging markets would continue to propel the company alongside it's major customers.

review_title: My experience with UR has been world class - Top notch company to work for.
pros: Exposure to the industry at the highest level, interacting with people & organizations that UR has partnered with. Top commisioned pay - rewarded for the efforts put forth.  Recognized & promoted for the hard work ethic put forward.
cons: UR only employes the very best of the best - making sure the efforts put forth for day to day business are enough.

review_title: 20 + years in the industry and United Rentals is the best company I have worked for.
pros: United Rentals is the whole package as an employer - Compensation, Benefits, Leadership, People, Community involvement, Vision and much, much more.  A company that continues to get better with age.
cons: Any problems or challenges at United Rentals are the same that you would face at any job in any industry.

review_title: United is committed to us as employees, the proof is thru continued training and growth
job_title: OUTSIDE SALES in San Marcos, TX
pros: The people. Working together with people who care care past the 5 o’clock. The community involvement is amazing. This is a great diverse work place where ideas are welcomed, shared, and celebrated.
cons: There are a lot of moving parts with a large company. Some times it might take some time to learn,

pros: United Rentals is truly committed to upholding its company values.  The company has a world class commitment to safety, customer service and its team members.  The people of the organization are committed to working hard and looking out for each other.  Senior management understands that the strength of the organization is the people that make up the organization.
cons: While there are many opportunities for career advancement many of these opportunities are very competitive and could be limiting if you are not willing to relocate.

review_title: Lots of opportunity, lots of pressure
pros: There is so much opportunity to jump into this industry and gain lots of experience, especially in the sales and leadership arena. The company really tries to invest in employee development.
cons: We run so lean, it can be overwhelming at times to do the work that really might be better distributed among more heads. In both sales and leadership capacities, work will come home with you.

pros: Great product, great growth, decent products, service and equipment.
cons:
The corporation is just that, a corporation that is far more worried about protecting itself, its profits and position than any care they have for employees.  They even require every applicant to submit to arbitration just for submitting an application which is insanity.

If anything ever goes wrong, you will never have a chance to have them get your side of the story nor any legal recourse.

review_title: United purchased the company i worked for 18 months ago. Seems to be good.
pros: UR is tipical of large companies, pay is pretty good and the benefits are good. The work is steady and you will never be bored.
cons: can be very hectic. as with most public companies they want to get as much return on as few assets as possible.

review_title: Company is growing large..... But is it a good thing?
pros:
Training
All the overtime you want
New equipment
The list has gotten smaller as implementation of new practices are added along with your already large workload
cons:
Trench underpaid compared to other divisions
High turnover at trench branches
Safety is preached but they keep branches lean and understaffed, so you generally have to cut 
corners
Pay is 15% lower than competitors
Benefits are not as good anymore

job_title: Territory Sales Representative in Calgary, AB
pros: Company benefits from day 1, company vehicle, reasonable base salary, invest in training.
cons: Sales Force will run your life, managers will no sales experience trying to manage a sales team.  Seem to be more interested in managing by objective rather than managing by performance.

review_title: Outside Salews Rep with lots of Growth
job_title: Outside Sales Representative in Fort Worth, TX
pros: United Rentals has lots of opportunity for advancement. Name brand recognition plus the fleet to back you up. As an OSR you have every opportunity to add fleet to your territory plus fatten your check with used equipment sales. United Rental truly is a one stop shop. Trench, Pump, Tool, Power and HVAC, Safety, Reliable On Site Services, true 24 hour service. Plus our online services can’t be touched.
cons: None except if your lazy dont apply.

job_title: Human Resources in Saint Paul, MN
pros: I started with United Rentals a few years ago  - from outside the industry. Best move ever. After finding out more - I wanted to be a part of this  - an organziation full of smart, hard working people. I've seen consistant improvment and refinement - each year gets more exciting.I have a huge sense of pride being a part of this group and can't wait to see what happens next.
cons: Not alot of turn over

job_title: Inside Sales Representative in Oak Creek, WI
pros: There really is a lot of potential to make a lot of money. How much you want to make depends on how much work you put in, and what you willing to do to earn business, win the deal, get that 'yes' from the customer.
cons:
At my location there was absolutely no teamwork or feeling of camaraderie. Everyone was out to work or protect themselves and as a result the job was many times harder than it should have been. 

There was also an overwhelming amount of sexism going on at my location. Rarely that I feel respected at my workplace, and because of that I only lasted 15 months

review_title: United Rentals is a great company that cares about its customers and employees and the customer experience.
pros: United Rentals has very good benefits for their employees as well as a wide variety of equipment and solutions for its customers. There are many opportunities to voice your opinion and have it heard within the company.
cons: There are no cons at United Rentals, it is a great place to work.

pros: Great sales Training, benefit packages, company vehicle, cell phone and lap top.
cons: Not a lot of positive reinforcement from management, have to be on call during your assigned week and were responsible for managing all service calls in the entire metro area 24/7. You could end up with 10 service calls by 8am on Saturday morning when they start at 3AM or you could end up with zero the entire week if you are lucky.

pros: United Rentals has been a great place to work. They offer excellent career opportunities, and great pay and benefits. One thing that has stood out to me is there willingness to advance employees based on merit and not on tenure. You work hard here, you get rewarded.
cons: Tough to say. The hours can be long, but that's to be expected when the company is willing to put so much responsibility in your hands.

pros: Excellent pay and benefits, opportunity for advancement, strives for world class safety of employees, team oriented environment, opportunities to meet many new people and develop working relationships, continual technological and process improvement.
cons: Demanding pace especially during peak season, corporate oversight, occasional unpredictable hours in the evenings and 24-7 responsibility to answer calls for some positions.

pros:
United rentals is a great place to work. Hard work = success. 
Lots of Opp for development.
cons: Strong business values. Better communication between sale and opps would make company more effective. Changes to corporate structure will help growth.

pros: The first few years were good, was able to make good business decisions that made sense for both the business and the customers.
cons:
* Buddy system to get promoted, many people that were in regional leadership positions were completely unqualified to lead.

* There was no team work, things were what have you done for me lately and back stabbing was common place, people would do whatever it took to make them look good.

job_title: Inside Sales Representative in Ponca City, OK
pros: United rentals is a good company to work for. They have descent benefits and the pay is okay. The employees get a long and help out where they are needed.
cons: They say they promote from with-in, but do not. I was told a few lies about upper mobility. There is a good ol' boy network, if you are in it you will go far.

pros: UR is the leader in the industry and has expanded rapidly over the past several decades. Numerous acquisitions have expanded the footprint. Plenty of opportunity for advancement for ambitious employees.
cons: Effort and ambition is valued from the bottom up; however, there is a growing tendency towards top-down management. Metrics are established at the corporate level and individual profit centers are highly accountable to regional offices. Or is this a plus?

pros: Family culture, URI beleives we should take care of each other and it is a great place to work. I have worked for the company for 9 years and highly recommend it. Our Manager's and Executives care about your well being and I am proud to work for such an amazing company.
cons: For those of you reading the negatives don't beleive everything you read! Is URI perfect, no but you tell me what company is?

review_title: Progressive, shareholder driven corporation focused on growth
job_title: National Account Manager in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: United pays well, is engaged in employee happiness. Several career advancement opportunities for producing employees, company is creating new positions as they focus on diversifying their equipment offering.
cons: United consist of several acquired companies, cultural issues remain across the company. It is harder to work internally due to the politics and processes than it is to work with customers.

job_title: Driver CDL A in Longview, TX
pros: Had a very good safty program with alot of opportunity to move up in the company. Also the people I worked with were like family and it made for a great work day everyday
cons: I didn't injoy the on call time and the way you were paid for it.also the full fast was a pain in the butt only working right half of the time
